meanings.definition: To outdo in a playful or mischievous manner.
meanings.sent1: The children tried to outcaper each other in the game of tag.
meanings.sent2: She always manages to outcaper her friends with her funny pranks.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel decided to outcaper the other animals by stealing their nuts.
meanings.sent4: The comedian seemed to outcaper everyone with his hilarious jokes.
meanings.sent5: The playful puppy would outcaper its siblings by running around in circles.

meanings.definition: A person who outdoes others in a playful or mischievous manner.
meanings.sent1: The little outcaper in the group always had a new trick up their sleeve.
meanings.sent2: She was known as the class outcaper for her funny antics.
meanings.sent3: The outcaper at the party kept everyone entertained with their jokes.
meanings.sent4: The outcaper of the office always brought laughter to the workplace.
meanings.sent5: The outcaper of the family gatherings was the one who made everyone smile.
